intro: Microtropis curranii var. zambalesensis, commonly known as the Zambales microtropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, specifically the Zambales region, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in lowland forests and secondary vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
